website_summaries.verdict: Sega's 15-year old ode to street culture may suffer from a few dated design choices, but the skating-and-tagging title remains an enjoyable experience due to its fast action, humor, and excellent soundtrack.
pros: Gorgeous cel-shaded graphics given the HD treatment
Ability to create your own tags

customer_reviews.title: This port works nicely for me
customer_reviews.text: Brings back childhood memories with my Dreamcast! This port works nicely for me, redeemed on steam and plays easy with a controller.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K

customer_reviews.title: Fun yet challenging.
customer_reviews.text: It's a fun game. If you like skating around and spraying graffiti on various things. However it does have its challenges, personally I don't like a challenge all to well.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great game at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This game brought me back to my childhood. Great game at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Rozalin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I love this game. One of my all time favorites.
customer_reviews.author: nupe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just buy this game if you like funky sounding ost's in sega games
customer_reviews.author: Wakemaster

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It's Jet Set Radio. I really don't need to say much more. If you liked it before, you'll like it now. Wish they had done a little work to update the controls and camera but can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I love downloads
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Amazon for providing downloadable games! I have purchased many PC games from Amazon because now I can download it and play it without having to worry about CD/DVDs getting worn or scratched. And I can backup all of my data. This Jet Set Radio download is for Steam only. Requires a Steam account and included Steam DRM.
customer_reviews.author: Brian McCracken

customer_reviews.title: Check for intel hd 1000 support
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly on intel hd graphics. I didn't expect it to actually work due to how old the game is.
customer_reviews.author: nathan moffitt

customer_reviews.title: Game gets 5 Stars, Steam makes it 1 star
customer_reviews.text: The game itself gets 5 STARS but the way they force you to install Steam to play it, it kills the fun, not worth it. Once again, the game is awesome, Steam ruins it!
customer_reviews.author: SidNa1984

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Games Ever Made
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has never owned a SEGA Dreamcast I've always wanted to play Jet Set Radio. When the game was announced for PC I was ecstatic. Now that I have poured in enough hours into the game to beat it I can state that the game has aged like wine. The visuals are gorgeous, the gameplay is fun and addicting. Highly recommend to anybody who wants to give this a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Nader K. Omar

customer_reviews.title: Cannot save the game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game and was fun on the SEGA, but on Steam it is bad. I just bought this on Steam, and after playing it I found that the 'save game' option is unavailable. YOU CANNOT SAVE YOUR GAME WITH THIS VERSION! Since this is sold as a code for Steam I felt putting a warning on here was a good idea. After reading some more reviews it seems it is a glitch that was never addressed. If not being able to save does not bother you then go ahead and get it.
customer_reviews.author: Cordial

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: To me it is actually the best multiplayer game of all time. One of the best games ever. It has an awesome story line with great multiplayer gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: Perrish Goggins

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia bait but a terrible game.
customer_reviews.text: I understand a lot of people have pleasant nostalgia for this game. But when I played it I found it painfully repetitive, with a disgustingly bland "future of the 90s" j-pop sound track, a physics engine more broken than the Obamacare website, characters so embarrassingly racist they will make you wince and a plot that could generously be called nonsense bullcrap. I'll give it an extra star because it tries hard to make a unique identity for itself but I could not recommend this game to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

product_meta.title: Jet Set Radio [Download]
product_meta.description:
Tag, grind, and trick to the beat in SEGA’s hit game Jet Set Radio!

Fight for control of Tokyo-to, mark your turf with graffiti, tag walls, billboards, and even rival gang members! Perform tricks and flips on magnetically driven in-line skates, but watch out for the local police force!

Heritage Collection treatment:
Now available via PC Digital download, Jet Set Radio is part of Sega’s Heritage Collection series and now features lush HD visuals, developer interviews, and amazing fan-created graffiti.

Classic Beats:
Skate to the funky tunes of Pirate Radio! Jet Set Radio still features 29 of 30 tracks from the original Dreamcast release.

Express yourself:
Choose from a massive catalog of classic and new graffiti or create your own and use it to tag walls, billboards, cars, and even rival gang members!

The gang’s all here:
Recruit more than 10 playable characters to your gang, each with their own unique graffiti!



Requires Steam Client to activate.


SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
Minimum Specifications: OS: Win 7, Vista and XP Processor: Pentium 4 1.3GHz or Athlon MP RAM: 256 MB Hard Drive: 982 MB Video Card: GeForce 7050 or Radeon X1270 Additional Info: DirectX 9.0c 

© SEGA. SEGA, the SEGA logo and JET SET RADIO are either registered trademarks or trademarks of SEGA Corporation. All rights reserved.
